library.name: Matricies
library.description: Library for performing operations on matrices.

class.name: Matrix
class.description: Represents an n by m matrix of floats.

function.name: newIdentityMatrix
function.description: Generates a new n by n identity matrix.

arg.name: n
arg.description: The size of the matrix (it's a square).

function.name: getValue
function.description: Gets the value at the given column and row

function.name: setValue
function.description: Sets a value at the given column and row

returns.description: Returns a reference to the original matrix so that chaining can be used.

function.name: multiplyByScalar
function.description: Multiplies all values in the matrix by a scalar

arg.name: value
arg.description: The scalar value to multiply by.

returns.description: Returns a reference to the original matrix so that chaining can be used.

function.name: addMatrix
function.description: Adds another matrix to this matrix and writes it to the optional output matrix

arg.name: other
arg.description: The matrix to add to this matrix.

arg.name: output
arg.description: The matrix to write the result to. If this is not provided, the new values will be written to the original Matrix.

returns.description: Returns a reference to the original matrix so that chaining can be used.

function.name: multiplyByMatrix
function.description: Multiplies another matrix to this matrix and writes it to the optional output matrix. Dimensions must be correct.

arg.name: other
arg.description: The matrix to multiply this matrix by.

arg.name: output
arg.description: The matrix to write the result to. If this is not provided, the new values will be written to the original Matrix ONLY if the matrix is square. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

returns.description: Returns a reference to the original matrix so that chaining can be used.

function.name: toVector
function.description: Flattens the matrix into a single dimensional list. Values are written starting from the top left corner and go left-to-right first, then row-by-row down.

arg.name: output
arg.description: A list to write to. Values are written starting from position 0. If the list is not long enough, values will be added. If the list is longer than the number of elements in the matrix, the remaining values are left alone.

function.name: copyFrom
function.description: Copies the values of one matrix into another.

arg.name: other
arg.description: The matrix to copy values from. Must be the same size.

returns.description: Returns a reference to the original matrix so that chaining can be used.
